name: TheAtlantic
text: The killing of a black man at the hands of the police in Minneapolis has stirred outrage. The latest Atlantic Daily from @mimbsy. https://t.co/wfZM1jzqjM

name: TheAtlantic
text: The interest Joe Biden has expressed in Susan Rice reflects his concerns that the ongoing economic and public-health crisis the U.S. faces may require him to pick a strong national-security hand as his running mate, @IsaacDovere reports. https://t.co/Ki2rtUDe9D

name: TheAtlantic
text: A new Netflix documentary about Jeffrey Epstein gives voice to the women who say the financier abused them. But it is strikingly unclear on Epstein himself, and on the circle of privilege that helped to protect him, @sophieGG writes. https://t.co/hm5CuZCePg

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Rioting is abhorrent. Trump‚Äôs incendiary call for illegal acts is more likely to fuel than stop it‚Äì‚Äìespecially if any police act on his irresponsible words," @conor64 writes. https://t.co/BTDj0dZQv3

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Doomsday planners can‚Äôt conjure every possible future calamity. But their warnings can prompt the government to react quickly, to adapt to ambiguity, and to treat uncertainty as a feature of good social science," writes @marcambinder: https://t.co/HFrkZN6vDx

name: TheAtlantic
text: The economist Tyler Cowen believes that America's regulatory state failures are significantly hurting the response to the pandemic. "They are not small matters; they are major reasons America has confronted this crisis so poorly," he tells @conor64. https://t.co/JxUvD615QS

name: TheAtlantic
text: ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs important that you remember who your friend is, that they are not just a set of political policies.‚Äù In this week‚Äôs installment of The Friendship Files, @julieebeck talks with a liberal and a conservative about how they make their friendship work: https://t.co/z0KsVSsGew

name: TheAtlantic
text: Peaceful protest marches earlier in the day gave way to chaotic scenes as several buildings were broken into and set on fire, including the Minneapolis Police 3rd Precinct building, which was abandoned during the protest. https://t.co/v8FXE3v6Zu

text: Donald Trump called protesters in Minneapolis ‚Äúthugs.‚Äù In 2015, Megan Garber examined the context of that word: ‚ÄúTo dismiss someone as a ‚Äòthug‚Äô is also to dismiss his or her claims to outrage.‚Äù https://t.co/SRn6mQQwRv

name: TheAtlantic
text: In the middle of the pandemic, undocumented immigrants with COVID-19 have been forgoing health care because they're scared to alert federal immigration authorities, @JeremyRaff reports: https://t.co/TwwBiPJgGe

name: TheAtlantic
text: Despite its small-screen influences and tiny budget, "The Vast of Night" is shockingly cinematic, overflowing with the kind of inventiveness you rarely see from a first-time filmmaker, @davidlsims writes of the sci-fi thriller now on Amazon Prime Video: https://t.co/h2Zz1tFHSi

name: TheAtlantic
text: "I‚Äôve found many things to love about working out in isolation. But still, I miss the gym. So I decided to try to figure out what exactly it is that I miss, and whether it‚Äôs gone forever," Michael Owen reports: https://t.co/jhyHKhofLl
